meanings.definition: A small seed or egg of an insect
meanings.sent1: The bugseed hatched into a tiny caterpillar.
meanings.sent2: I found a bugseed on the leaf while gardening.
meanings.sent3: The bugseed rolled off the table and onto the floor, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a treasure trove of bugseeds waiting to sprout.
meanings.sent5: The bugseed, like a secret gem, held the promise of new life.

meanings.sent1: Please don't bugseed me while I'm trying to concentrate.
meanings.sent2: His constant questions bugseeded her throughout the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The persistent fly continued to bugseed the picnic attendees.
meanings.sent4: The repetitive sound of the dripping faucet bugseeded her into action.
meanings.sent5: The buzzing mosquito bugseeded everyone at the campfire.

meanings.definition: A source of annoyance or frustration
meanings.sent1: The broken printer was a bugseed in the office.
meanings.sent2: Her loud chewing was a bugseed during the movie.
meanings.sent3: The traffic jam was a bugseed on their road trip.
meanings.sent4: The leaky roof became a bugseed during the rainy season.
meanings.sent5: The never-ending paperwork was a bugseed for the employees.
